item.title: Decency in Tech
item.author: felix.brilej@googlemail.com (Felix Brilej)
item.description: This week I spontaneously attended a presentation on AWS security. The talk was highly interesting! The presenter showed his personal involvement with the topic, while the content was up-to-date, well chunked, extensively researched and battle-tested. During the Q&A at the end of the presentation though, the presenter got picked apart. The questions all double-checked whether the presenter was as good as he seemed. They were all aimed at finding a technical mistake in the slides, or intended point out a missed opportunity for improvement. This Q&A session really slapped it in my face: The dimension of decency in tech.
